# Security Policy

## Supported Versions

Currently, this project is in active development. Security updates are applied to the latest version.

| Version | Supported          |
| ------- | ------------------ |
| latest  | :white_check_mark: |
| < 1.0   | :x:                |

## Reporting a Vulnerability

The security of this project is taken seriously. If you discover a security vulnerability, please follow these steps:

### 1. Do Not Open a Public Issue
Please do not open a public GitHub issue if the bug is a security vulnerability.

### 2. Report via Email or Private Channel
- **Primary Contact**: @chaishillomnitech1
- **Email**: Please reach out through GitHub private message or create a security advisory

### 3. Provide Detailed Information
When reporting a vulnerability, please include:
- Description of the vulnerability
- Steps to reproduce the issue
- Potential impact
- Any suggested fixes (if available)
- Your contact information for follow-up

### 4. Response Timeline
- **Initial Response**: Within 48 hours of report
- **Status Update**: Within 7 days with assessment and plan
- **Fix Timeline**: Varies based on severity and complexity

## Security Best Practices

### For Contributors
- Never commit sensitive data (API keys, passwords, tokens) to the repository
- Use environment variables for configuration
- Keep dependencies up to date
- Follow secure coding practices
- Run security scans before submitting PRs

### For Users
- Always use the latest version
- Review and understand code before deployment
- Use secure authentication methods
- Keep your deployment environment secure
- Report any suspicious activity

## Security Updates

Security updates will be announced through:
- GitHub Security Advisories
- Repository releases
- Direct notifications to affected parties

## Automated Security

This repository uses:
- GitHub Dependabot for dependency updates
- CodeQL for code scanning (when applicable)
- Security policy enforcement through GitHub Actions

## Disclosure Policy

- Vulnerabilities will be disclosed after a fix is available
- Credit will be given to security researchers (unless anonymity is requested)
- A reasonable time window will be provided for users to update

## Security Resources

- [GitHub Security Best Practices](https://docs.github.com/en/code-security)
- [OWASP Top 10](https://owasp.org/www-project-top-ten/)
- [CWE/SANS Top 25](https://cwe.mitre.org/top25/)

## Contact

For security concerns, please contact:
- **Repository Owner**: @chaishillomnitech1
- **GitHub Security Advisories**: Use the "Security" tab in this repository

---
Thank you for helping keep this project and its users safe!
